messageBody:
Russell Gold wrote:
> On Wed, 8 Sep 2004 11:00:32 +0200, Ilja Preuss
> <preuss@...> wrote:
>> Basically, I wanted my servlet to use an object from the
>> ServletContext. For the test, I wanted to inject a mock
>> implementation, naturally.
>>
>> The only way I found to make this work was to use the
>> InvocationContext to access the ServletContext (via Servlet and
>> ServletConfig) and then call the service method manually (quite
>> similar to the way J.B. uses in his recipe).
>>
>> Not what I would call straight forward - I would have prefered to
>> somehow being able to configure the context via the ServletRunner.
>
> Very reasonable. I have just added a new method to ServletRunner:
>
> HttpSession getSession( boolean create );
>
> which should do what you want. I will commit it to CVS tonight.

That's an improvement - but as far as I can tell, that doesn't give me a
way to access the *ServletContext*??? That's what I need... (The object
I want to mock is not user specific.)

Thanks, Ilja
